Text: I hate rar's. I upload all the time and NEVER zip any of my files. Zipped files can contain viruses and other crap that no one wants. My uploads possess files in their native format (mp3, avi, mp4, etc). Rethink your use of zipped files.

It's a scene release, most all scene releases are Rar'd, reups from initial scene releases are unRar'd.

So you want to have a go at those who provide the material you want initially just because it's Rar'd for initials distribution.

When knobs upload crap, it's usually one Rar file not the usual 15Mb whatever used by scene which is to do with packet math in the hash.

Why not go cap these things yourself instead of making a big issue out of what others provide for you just because scene cappers Rar for other primary distribution methods?

Exactly!!!
